channel.title: Anyone know an Anti Flooder program?
channel.description:
Currently I have 1 connection per IP and the nulls have come along. I've heard there is a program to stop nulls, but I can't find it anywhere. I've had anti null before but when I heard that there was a program I decided to get the 1 connection per ip; since I wasn't being nulled at the time and I hoped I could find it before I got nulled, long story short; I didn't. If anyone can find/has an anti flooder, and will let me use it, thank you.
I'm out

Im getting the same error as TheLetterQArousesMe… and t4, can you spoon feed a little bit - it won’t kill you, i mean Obvisouly you need to be more specific around us “beginners” I clicked those links and im not a genius so i defiantly need help.

item.title: Anyone know an Anti Flooder program?
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:11, topic:431932”][quote author=t4 link=topic=534639.msg3912794#msg3912794 date=1328913722]

Are you using allstarscape?

what does this have to do with the discussion?
[/quote]

The OP asked about an anti-flooder, I’m assuming for his server, and also assuming he’s using allstarscape. There’s a bug in allstarscape that allows people before logging in to pre-log in and send themselves as logged in while they aren’t actually logged in. It shows as null when you type ::players and also eventually crashes the server.[/quote]

plus his server is successfully getting “nulled”.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know an Anti Flooder program?

item.title: Anyone know an Anti Flooder program?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:10, topic:431932”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=534639.msg3912670#msg3912670 date=1328907414]
Are you using allstarscape?
[/quote]
what does this have to do with the discussion?[/quote]

The OP asked about an anti-flooder, I’m assuming for his server, and also assuming he’s using allstarscape. There’s a bug in allstarscape that allows people before logging in to pre-log in and send themselves as logged in while they aren’t actually logged in. It shows as null when you type ::players and also eventually crashes the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone know an Anti Flooder program?
item.dc:creator: @TheLetterQArousesMe TheLetterQArousesMe
item.description:
@TheLetterQArousesMe wrote:

If ConnectionMap contains IncomingAddress If System.currentTimeMillis() - ConnectionMap.get(IncomingAddress) > 3000L //If the last connection is greater than 3 seconds Allow Connection Else Close Connection Else Allow Connection
cannot find symbol method get (java.lang.String) The line of code: if(System.currentTimeMillis() - list.get(connectingHost) > 3000) { Not good with this type of thing, + I'm a bit tired and confused currently... meh I'll get to fixing it

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know an Anti Flooder program?

item.title: Anyone know an Anti Flooder program?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“TheLetterQArousesMe, post:5, topic:431932”][quote author=t4 link=topic=534639.msg3908701#msg3908701 date=1328476275]
So you believe NULL is a ‘flooder’? I don’t know exactly what a flooder is, but based on the context I believe you think it’s someone committing a malicious act.

The truth of the matter is that NULL is actually a memory address. You see Java, like other languages, has the ability to allocate memory on the heap rather than the stack. This is what the new keyword does in Java, C (malloc), and C++ to name a few. NULL is the memory address of 0, it is reserved for pointers (or references in the case of java) that do not point to any position in memory.

How does this occur? In Java, two ways:

The reference has been manually set to NULL

Object myObject = null;

Or the memory the reference was pointing to has gone out of scope

//...
private void doSomething() {
     Object myObject = new Object();
}
//...

As you can see the scope of myObject is restricted to that method. When the method returns, the object is no longer accessible and garbage collection comes along and cleans up the no longer accessible memory allocation.
[/quote]
I don’t believe null is a flooder. The program being used to spam my server logs players in as “null” over 100 times. It’s rather annoying.[/quote]
If your issue is reoccurring, possibly simultaneous connections from one source I suggest trying to throttle connections. An easy way to do this is to have a map keyed by connecting address (you can use the InetAddress object in Java which you can get from the incoming connection Socket) and have an long as it’s value (the longs value should be the last successful log in timestamp - you can obtain this using System.currentTimeMillis()). When an incoming connection is found, simply making a conditional like the following:
[tt]
If ConnectionMap contains IncomingAddress
If System.currentTimeMillis() - ConnectionMap.get(IncomingAddress) > 3000L //If the last connection is greater than 3 seconds
Allow Connection
Else
Close Connection
Else
Allow Connection[/tt]

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know an Anti Flooder program?

This is what the new keyword does in Java, C (malloc), and C++ to name a few. NULL is the memory address of 0, it is reserved for pointers (or references in the case of java) that do not point to any position in memory.
